page.title: 13RECREATION
page.content: The types and varieties of recreational activities reflect the rural nature of the area. Many of the hobbies are pursued individually and do not require much travel but make use of the countryside in which we live. The most popular are gardening, handicrafts, reading, music, horse riding, walking, nature study, shooting,tennis, cricket, photography, fishing, dancing, cooking and cycling. There are several leisure centres with reasonable access by public transport providing a wide variety of physical activities. Theatres and cinema are also within fairly easy reach. The village pubs provide more leisurely activities: darts, dominoes, cribbage, bar billiards, shove ha'penny and Aunt Sally which has teams in the district league.
